generator: { perfect(N) : num(N) }. divisor(M,N) :- num(N), num(M), M < N, N \ M == 0.

hard_constraints.description: It is formally required that any integer N designated as a perfect number must satisfy the condition that the summation of its set of proper divisors is numerically equivalent to the value of N.
hard_constraints.asp_rule: :- perfect(N), S = #sum { M : divisor(M,N) }, S != N.

hard_constraints.description: It is mandatory that every integer N within the defined domain that fulfills the arithmetic definition of a perfect number must be categorized as such in the solution set.
hard_constraints.asp_rule: :- num(N), S = #sum { M : divisor(M,N) }, S == N, not perfect(N).
